docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Johnny Pesky's long connection to the Boston Red Sox began when Pesky was a rookie shortstop in 1942 and broke into major league baseball with 205 hits. After his playing career ended in 1954, he worked for the Red Sox at various times as coach, manager, radio-television announcer, advertising salesman and special assistant to Lou Gorman, the general manager.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The status of Manager Joe Morgan of the Boston Red Sox was settled yesterday when he was rewarded with another one-year contract extension through 1991.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Tony Conigliaro, who died of pneumonia and kidney failure Saturday eight years after suffering a near-fatal heart attack that had left him an invalid, was remembered here today as a local boy who played the outfield and was a home run hitter for the Boston Red Sox.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Ellis Burks. the Boston Red Sox center fielder, underwent arthroscopic surgery yesterday to repair torn cartilage in his left shoulder.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Dennis (Oil Can) Boyd of the Boston Red Sox was admitted to University of Massachusetts Medical Center in Worcester yesterday for treatment of a blood clot near the right shoulder.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: In an interview with Barbara Walters that was broadcast last night on the ABC program ''20-20,'' Wade Boggs, the Boston Red Sox third baseman, said Margo Adams threatened to make his life difficult if he broke off their four-year affair. Boggs said he worried Adams would blackmail him with pictures she had taken of them.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Wade Boggs will contest Margo Adams's lawsuit in court rather than try to reach a settlement with the woman with whom he had a four-year extramarital affair, the Boston Red Sox third baseman said yesterday after giving an eight-hour deposition in Tampa, Fla.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: At no time this season have the Yankees won eight games in a row. At no time since Joe Morgan became Boston's manager have the Red Sox failed to win at least two games in any seven-game stretch.
